bibl.title: Supplementum Hellenisticum 948-9: Callimachus, Hecale?
bibl.note: Dr. Richard Hunter (The Argonautica of Apollonius, 1993, p. 56 n. 44) cites Professor Peter Parsons as suggesting, in a private letter, that the hero in Suppl. Hell. 949 might be referred to the man who drove from Aphidnae in Callimachus' Hecale (fr. 42 H. = Suppl. Hell. 285, 7-12, cf. fr. 253, 7-12 Pf.). Our source for Suppl. Hell. 948-9, P. Oxy. XXXIX, 2886, might indeed be from Callimachus' Hecale, but represent a different part of the poem, concerned with Theseus' upbringing in Troezen.
